about.name: Bill Wallbaum
about.bio: It's amazing how fast the world changes. When I first started a simple flat image was great. Today's designer knows 3-d, video and motion graphics, vector design, social media management, UX/UI design and so much more. Over the past 15 years, I have learned so much, and continue to learn every day. I do it so when you come to me with the question 'Why should I choose you?' I can truly say 'I'm ready'. Together, we can go... beyond creative.

education.area: Bachelor of Science in Graphic Design
Associate of Applied Science in Graphic Design

responsibilities: Conceptualize and design engaging email marketing campaigns and social media content, resulting in increased click-through rates and engagement.
Create high-quality print materials, including magazine ads and mailers, using Adobe Creative Suite.
Manage and maintain the company's website using WordPress and Shopify.
Conduct regular analytics audits and integrate data into marketing campaigns for improved ROI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing and product development, to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.
Create and execute marketing campaigns, including social networking and web page development, for a variety of clients.
Design high-quality print materials, including brochures, magazines, and vehicle graphics, using Adobe Creative Suite.
Manage client relationships, including leading client meetings and presenting design concepts.
Develop and maintain brand identities for a variety of clients.
Utilize After Effects and Premier to create engaging video content for clients.

responsibilities: Created and executed successful print and digital marketing campaigns for a variety of clients, resulting in increased engagement and sales.
Designed high-quality print materials, including brochures, business cards, and book covers, using Adobe Creative Suite.
Managed client relationships, including leading client meetings and presenting design concepts.
Coordinated with vendors to ensure the timely delivery of materials.
Developed and implemented new design processes to increase efficiency and improve quality control.
